official-title.#text:
Recognizing the friendship between the United Kingdom and the United States and expressing the
			 support of the House of Representatives for a united, secure, and
			 prosperous United Kingdom.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text:
believes that a united, secure, and prosperous United Kingdom is important for U.S. national
			 security priorities in Europe and around the world;
expresses deep friendship toward the Scottish people;

respects the right of the Scottish people to make their decision regarding their status in the
			 September 18, 2014, referendum;

expresses a firm commitment to continued cooperation between the United States and the United
			 Kingdom toward a more peaceful and prosperous world; and
expresses support for a united, secure, and prosperous United Kingdom.

Whereas this relationship between the United States and the United Kingdom is based on shared
			 values of democracy, individual freedom, and the rule of law;

Whereas British statesman Winston Churchill in 1946 labeled the relationship between the United
			 States and the United Kingdom the Special Relationship because of the
			 unprecedented depth of cooperation and the extensive historic ties between
			 the two nations;

Whereas throughout the 20th and early 21st centuries, the United States and the United Kingdom
			 fought together in several struggles, including the First and Second World
			 Wars, in which millions of American and British soldiers sacrificed for
			 their countries;
Whereas the 300th anniversary of the Union of Scotland and England occurred on May 1, 2007;

Whereas in accordance with an agreement between the Scottish Government and the United Kingdom
			 Government, a referendum will be held in Scotland on September 18, 2014,
			 on whether Scotland should be an independent country; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, Barack Obama, said the United
			 States has a

text.#text:
Whereas on June 5, 2014, speaking alongside the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, David

quote.#text:
deep interest in making sure that one of the closest allies we will ever have remains a strong,
			 robust, united and effective partner

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HRES 713 IH: Recognizing the friendship between the United Kingdom and the United States and expressing the support of the House of Representatives for a united, secure, and prosperous United Kingdom.
